questions.texte: How do plants obtain energy for survival?
questions.justification: Unlike animals, which must consume other living things for energy, plants can gain their energy from photosynthesis -- converting light energy to chemical energy.

questions.texte: Which equation is reversed in photosynthesis?
questions.justification: This equation may seem familiar -- in fact it's the exact same equation for cellular respiration from the first unit, except reversed!

questions.texte: What gas is released as a by-product of photosynthesis?
questions.justification: Plants take carbon dioxide and water, use energy (from light) to combine these together into glucose (a high-energy molecule), and oxygen is also produced as a by-product.

questions.texte: Why did spinach disks float in the lab experiment?
questions.justification: The baking soda (or sodium bicarbonate, NaHCO3) acted as a source of carbon dioxide for photosynthesis, and the disks began to float because they produced oxygen bubbles.

questions.texte: What is the function of the cuticle in plant leaves?
questions.justification: Many leaves are protected by a waxy coating called a cuticle, and soap is good at washing through waxy/fatty/oily substances to allow the solution to penetrate inside.

questions.texte: What role do plants play in the food chain?
questions.justification: Plants ('producers') absorb energy from the Sun, which forms the bottom of the food chain.

questions.texte: What would happen to the food chain without plants?
questions.answerB: Animals would evolve to make energy
questions.justification: Without plants, there would be no source of energy, and so the food chain would collapse!

questions.texte: What were the first photosynthetic organisms on Earth?
questions.justification: The first organisms capable of photosynthesis were simple prokaryotes called cyanobacteria.

questions.texte: Which organelle in plant cells is responsible for photosynthesis?
questions.justification: Chloroplasts contain a green-colored substance called chlorophyll, which is a molecular 'antenna' or 'solar panel' that absorbs light and starts the reaction of photosynthesis.

questions.texte: What is one key structural difference between plant and animal cells?
questions.answerA: Plant cells have a rigid cell wall
questions.answerB: Plant cells have mitochondria, animals do not
questions.justification: Plant cells are more complex eukaryotic cells that contain chloroplasts, and have several other important differences from animal cells -- for example, they have a rigid cell wall outside of the cell membrane.
